metadata.Title: CVE-2022-37703 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: In Amanda 3.5.1, an information leak vulnerability was found in the calcsize SUID binary. An attacker can abuse this vulnerability to know if a directory exists or not anywhere in the fs. The binary will use `opendir()` as root directly without checking the path, letting the attacker provide an arbitrary path.

criterions.comment: amanda: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
